t: Psalm 9
For the director of music. To the tune of “The Death of the Son.” A psalm of David.
I*pn will give thanks to you, Lord,*s with all my heart; I*ld will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
I*ln will be glad and rejoice in you; I*ld will sing the praises of your name, O Most High.
My*pn enemies turn back; they*ld stumble and perish before you.
For*ln you have upheld my right and my cause, sitting*ld enthroned as the righteous judge.
You*ln have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; you*ld have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
Endless*ln ruin has overtaken my enemies, you*ld have uprooted their cities; even*ld the memory of them has perished.
The*pn Lord*s reigns forever; he*ld has established his throne for judgment.
He*ln rules the world in righteousness and*ld judges the peoples with equity.
The*ln Lord*s is a refuge for the oppressed, a*ld stronghold in times of trouble.
Those*ln who know your name trust in you, for*ld you, Lord,*s have never forsaken those who seek you.
Sing*pn the praises of the Lord,*s enthroned in Zion; proclaim*ld among the nations what he has done.
For*ln he who avenges blood remembers; he*ld does not ignore the cries of the afflicted.
Lord,*spn see how my enemies persecute me! Have*ld mercy and lift me up from the gates of death,
that*ln I may declare your praises in*ld the gates of Daughter Zion, and*ld there rejoice in your salvation.
The*pn nations have fallen into the pit they have dug; their*ld feet are caught in the net they have hidden.
The*ln Lord*s is known by his acts of justice; the*ld wicked are ensnared by the work of their hands.
The*ln wicked go down to the realm of the dead, all*ld the nations that forget God.
But*ln God will never forget the needy; the*ld hope of the afflicted will never perish.
Arise,*pn Lord,*s do not let mortals triumph; let*ld the nations be judged in your presence.
Strike*ln them with terror, Lord;*s let*ld the nations know they are only mortal.
